sidebar.title: Ceph Parameters
sidebar.para: You can use the included parameters to configure the monitoring of Ceph.

row.entry: Many of metrics are generated using ceph command. The command can take longer time to complete and behavior can vary from system to system. To be predictive, timeout has been set for command completion. Default value is set to 30 seconds. If your system is sluggish or under recovery, the command execution can take longer. In that case, you might like to tune it. Please note that the value is in seconds.
Option to include or exclude private pools
The pools metrics generates the top pools by default only for public pools. If you wish to include the private pools in top pools, then you should change this parameter to true
Option to change recommended public NIC speed in Mbps
If you are not using a complete scaled cloud, then you may like to tune the recommended public_nic_speed to a smaller value.

Option to change recommended private NIC speed by changing private_nic_speed_multiplier
Private_NIC = Public_NIC * private_nic_speed_multiplier

If you are not using a complete scaled cloud, then you may like to tune the recommended private_nic_speed_multiplier to a smaller value. Also, if you change the replication factor from the default value of 3 to a smaller value, then you might like to tune the private_nic_speed_multiplier likewise.
Option to change minimum RAM (in GiB) required for each TiB of data disk
If you are not using a complete scaled cloud, then you may like to tune the recommended ram_gib_per_tib to a smaller value.
Option to change optimal OSD disks for each journal disk

If you would like to use more number of osd's per journal disk i.e more than 4 osds per journal disk and also not want an alarm to be raised, then you can tune the optimal_osd_per_journal to a larger value. Doing so may result in performance degradation and result in a much slower ceph cluster. It is recommended not to change the default value as this may result in performance degradation and result in a much slower ceph cluster.

sidebar.title: Editing Configuration Parameters
sidebar.para: You can edit the Ceph monitoring parameters by editing the monitoring_settings.yml file in your cloud configuration.
sidebar.screen: ram_gib_per_tib : 1 public_nic_speed : 10000 private_nic_speed_multiplier : 3 include_private_pools: False ceph_command_timeout: 30 optimal_osd_per_journal: 4
